title: Prefigurative Community Building (Part 9): Repair Cafés as Revolutionary Practice - Mending Objects and Social Fabric
summary: Transform repair from individual burden to collective joy. Create spaces where neighbors learn to fix things together, building skills, trust, and resistance to throwaway culture through mutual aid.

Knowledge.summary: Democratize repair skills and technical knowledge through collaborative learning.

level0: Gather circle of people interested in repair and skill-sharing
Pick accessible space that welcomes mess and connection
level1: Create atmosphere where everyone teaches and learns
Focus on collaborative learning rather than expert service
level2: Build local 'Repair Wiki' documenting common fixes
Host themed repair sessions for specific items or skills
level3: Train others to facilitate repair events
Create network of repair spaces across region

Community.summary: Build social connections and mutual trust through shared practical problem-solving.

level0: Use horizontal coordination with rotating facilitation
Create welcoming atmosphere for all skill levels
level1: Build culture where mistakes and not-knowing are normalized
Practice asking for and offering help across difference
level2: Host regular gatherings that strengthen relationships over time
Celebrate successful repairs and learning moments
level3: Create permanent community infrastructure for ongoing skill sharing
Model mutual aid through tangible collaborative action

Narrative.summary: Challenge throwaway culture and learned helplessness through hands-on empowerment.

level0: Practice believing things and people are worth keeping
level1: Share stories about successful repairs and collective learning
level2: Help others see repair as resistance to planned obsolescence
Promote right to repair and maintenance culture
level3: Transform community understanding of waste and value
Build culture where repair is normal and celebrated
